item.title: [HBASE-10643] Failure in RS when using large size bucketcache
item.description:
When RS is brought up with XX:MaxDirectMemorySize of 22GB or higher, RS fails after a successful start. From the RS logs it looks like the bucketCache memory allocation is taking more time makes the RS considered dead by ZK. One option to fix the problem would be to allocate the bucketCache before registering with ZK.

item.summary: Failure in RS when using large size bucketcache

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
The RS initializes its connection to ZooKeeper very early in the startup process. The BucketCache isn't created until after assignments have been received and the first storefile is opened. Thus, the pause in allocating direct memory comes after the zk session is established.

One option would be to add a configuration point that, when enabled, will ask the RS to initialize it's cache structures before the ZK session is established. That way the pause won't disrupt the session. Other ideas?

Note that this should not be an issue with the BucketcCache running in file mode.

Did not encounter this issue when testing recently with bucket cache using the direct buffer ioengine and MaxDirectMemorySize of 24g and 32g. Can you share your JVM version particulars, command line options you might have put in hbase-env.sh, and have you changed any of the HBase site file settings pertaining to zookeeper?

Biju Nair This was running in EC2, no?
Yes. The tests were on EC2 using i2.8xlarge instances.
It takes that long allocating 22G of DM? (Pardon my ignorance)
Presumably, yes. There's a JvmPauseMonitor log in proximity to BlockCache initiation.

Also the failures were intermittent and not consistent i.e one or two of the RS fails and others were successful. There may be EC2 factors in play. But it would be good to allocate the memory before registering with ZK. I am assuming this will also help in handling issues like user configuring more memory than physically available.

FYI, I started up a machine with ~75GB of direct memory allocated to the RS yesterday. It took about 45sec to allocation the buffers, but it completely without aborting the RS. Will need to investigate further; could be we're initializing the various components in different threads, and I happened to not trigger the race this time.
